A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Reviewed 12.16.17. I've come to a conclusion. It is impossible to please aging Star War's fans. A new installment is never going to mean as much to you as the originals did when you were ten years old. Accept it. At the screening I attended\, kids loved it. Are these new installments perfect? No. And neither was the original trilogy. Blasphemy? Watch them again\, critiquing them as you would a new release. They are full of implausible moments and cheesy dialogue too. But they were highly entertaining nonetheless.  And so is The Last Jedi. They could have written it a thousand ways. And if I was choosing\, I'd have done it differently too. But it's as captivating as any of the original movies\, if you can return to your inner child.
